Reviews.Title: Excellent laptop, though certainly expensive
Reviews.Author: GSRfan01
Reviews.Content: I don't have this exact model as it's a ready to ship prebuild one. I got mine in June of 2012 so the specs vary and I will list them:- i7-3610QM- 8 GB DDR3- 750GB 7200RPM- 650M 1GB- 1600 x 900 resolutionThe build quality is excellent, the feel of the laptop when I use it is spectacular, it has a matte almost rubberish finish so it's not metal and doesn't get finger prints on it.The keyboard has some flex, but nothing that you'd ever notice during normal use. It also has one of the best keyboards that I have used, the feeling is excellent and is 2nd to the higher end business line of Lenovo laptops.The CPU is a powerhouse for being a mobile edition with 4 physical cores and hyperthreading you get 8 threads, combined with turboboost which can jump the 2.3 Ghz clock beyond 3.0Ghz this CPU blazes through tasks and anything I throw at it. While I have an i7 and this is an i5, the Ivy Bridge architecture with the 3rd generation is the same with both CPUs and is excellent, the i5 is a nice CPU and will handle anything you'd be able to throw at it with ease.The 650M with 1GB will run nearly any game on high at native resolution, just make sure to properly ventilate the laptop of the GPU will underclock itself due to the heat. The GPU's stock clock is 745Mhz and will go up to somewhere around 850Mhz if needed for short periods of time. The extra 1GB on this model will help with textures and will provide some overhead for future games.The AlienFX is nice and is part of the reason this laptop is expensive, you can set them to change to a different scheme when a certain .EXE file is running, which is great for games. As an example for Skyrim I would set the keyboard to go to all white. Some games implement the FX into the code of the game, like World of Tanks where if you get hit the keyboard will flash red.The laptop can run pretty hot, I always have it elevated and when gaming plug the fans in. Personally I use a Cooler Master Notepal U2 which fits the laptop perfectly. When gaming the fans can be fairly loud, but if you have the audio on it's hardly noticeable. My temps with some small overclocks stay around 70 degrees Celsius. Because of the heat dispersion layout, when the laptop gets hot the keyboard and palm rest do also.Battery life for me is what you would expect for such a powerful laptop, I can get about 3-5 hours depending on what is running, which is enough for me to make it through my classes. This i5 model will have better life because it's not running a quadcore CPU.This laptop should have an MSATA slot under the bottom cover, allowing for a second hard drive that can be used either for storage, or as caching to speed up your HDD, they range from 32GB up to 128GB+ and are slightly more expensive than a normal SSD. I have yet to get one and cannot evaluate their value as of yet. If this changed I will update this.There have been some issues with this laptop so I will list them:- I put the laptop into hibernate and it would not boot back up, needed a motherboard replacement. Dell / Alienware had a tech to my house in a couple of days and the laptop was back in perfect working order.- My "r" key needs to be replaced as it broke (the key itself not the mechanism) and they're sending someone out to replace the whole keyboard.- While not a real issue, the number of USB ports is slightly disappointing but I knew that going in.- I cannot natively run 3 monitors so far; I use the native screen, a 1600 x 900 HP through VGA and wanted to extend to my TV through HDMI but it will not allow that, I have heard that the Mini-Displayport may allow this but I have not bought an adapter. While a USB to VGA or DVI is always possibly I would rather a native solution be available.- Battery isn't easily removed, you need to unscrew 2 screws to take the bottom cover off, then 2 more to take out the battery which makes it difficult to carry more than one. My battery has so far experienced a 10.4% battery wear according to BatteryBar.On an end note: If you are experiencing very low FPS in a game in moderate settings, ensure you're using the dedicated card, the system uses Nvidia Optimus which allows you to use the dedicated card when needed and the HD4000 when it's not. You can make any program use the dedicated card simply by right clicking, going to "run with graphics processor" and opening the Nvidia Control Panel, adding the EXE to the list and selecting the dedicated card from the drop down.While there are other brands of laptops with similar or the same specs for ~$100 cheaper or so, I find this laptop to be worth the money, and when looking around, an Apple Macbook Pro of the same specs costs $1800 for me, where as I paid $1300 for my version.Edit 3/5/13: Last week the tech came out the and keyboard was replaced, I observed minimal dis-assembly of the laptop, consisting of the bottom, some screws, and the bezel around the keyboard, then 2 more screws, the ribbon strips for connection and FX, then a replacement. The new one does have the new windows logo implemented for Win 8 and is up to par with the prior keyboard.I will note that the lighting seems a little dimmer, especially with the space key. But this is in normal light and not darkness, when my room is dark the whole keyboard is clearly visible.

Reviews.Title: I love my Alienware M14x
Reviews.Author: Rachel
Reviews.Content: I love my laptop! Doesn't get hot and its great for gaming. Only thing I don't like about it is Windows 8, but that's not alienwares fault.

Reviews.Title: Such a great computer
Reviews.Author: Wstl310
Reviews.Content: Very powerful, the battery life isnt as grand as they say, and it would have been better with Windows 7 on it, but all in all very good laptop.

Reviews.Title: Happy Kid
Reviews.Author: Shada A. Rabi "supershada76"
Reviews.Content: I got this for my daughters 10th birthday, shes a gamer and says the graphics are awesome on this laptop. recommended for gamers

Reviews.Title: Eat My Alienware
Reviews.Author: HollywoodHeartbreaker
Reviews.Content: This is probably one of my most intelligent buys. Through the entire purchasing process, I was subjected to everyone's opinion of "but you can buy a laptop for $700! Why would you spend so much money for one?!"Well, quite simply, when it comes to technology, I'm all about class. My Alienware M14x delivers every time.Mine is in Nebula Red, and when it boots up, it puts the Enterprise to shame. Facial recognition software to login? You better believe it. Personalised name plate on the base? Uh-huh. Feeling of immense satisfaction of the overall quality of keystrokes, finishes and reliability? Constant.The fact is yes, it's very expensive for a 14 inch laptop (and relatively heavy), but I have taken it everywhere with me for work (and LOVE seeing the expressions on unexpecting faces as it comes to life) and can still use it at night for hardcore gaming marathons.If you like your computers, I can't recommend this highly enough. Thanks AW!!

Reviews.Title: Please dont buy this piece of garbage.
Reviews.Author: Jacob Theobald
Reviews.Content: As someone who has had one for awhile please listen to me. Don't under any circumstances buy the base model and unless they've fixed the overheating problem then PLEASE for the love of god don't buy this laptop. The overheating will cause you to drop to 20 fps or less every ten seconds. If you want the best for your money and don't want to build your own then go to cyberpowerPC.com. You could get a laptop there with the SAME hardware for half the price. I would say this laptop was an absolute waste of money. If they fixed the overheating and you want to spend more then you need to then go ahead and buy it.

Reviews.Title: Old man's dream.
Reviews.Author: Yong H Kang
Reviews.Content: All lights make it looking cool. However, I advise turn them off if you are not plugged in. It's solid build. Window 8 takes a good time to get used but I can always get to Window 7 interface. So far so good.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: bbyblueyes86
Reviews.Content: Exceeded expectations! Me and my husband are constantly fighting to use it. It is a little on the heavier side, but I like that because it can take a beating, especially since we have 3 kids. We have had for a couple of months and it still runs like new. I would definitely recommend this computer to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: Best of the best
Reviews.Author: Jaicas
Reviews.Content: This is my first Dell. I used Macbook pro, Vaio and Compaq, but this pc is in another category. somple the best.

Reviews.Title: too expensive for a outdated laptop
Reviews.Author: John stark
Reviews.Content: The configuration have already been outdated.Win 8 system isn't included in the price even though it marked with Win 8 installed.And it doesn't have warranty, which mean you have to pay all fees for repairing.

Reviews.Title: Decent laptop, wish it weren't quite so heavy!
Reviews.Author: B. Rankin
Reviews.Content: Decent laptop. I wish that Dell hadn't influenced Alienware as much as they have though. This is the second Dell laptop I've owned that gets strange keyboard smudges on the screen after it's been closed for a while. The first was an XPS 16... I think if the screen had offsets/stoppers on it to prevent the display from touching the keys, it wouldn't be a problem.

Reviews.Title: My laptop arrived today
Reviews.Author: Anatoly
Reviews.Content: Today I have finnally received my laptop,this was my dream laptop,I wanted to buy it for a long time! I have to admit that the shipment was preety fast I will give it a 5 star. So when I have collected my laptop from the post and I started to open it I have noticed that the laptop was packed very poorly,it allmost did not had any protection on it,moreover when I turned on my laptop I have immideately noticed that it had  a defect on the the right side,the piece of plastic were coming off!Which immideatelly ruined my expectations and ruined my whole day! But it is nothing to what happened to this laptop next,when I started working with it,the black death on the screen showed up,which really shocked me!!!!!The next thing I was asking myself, how can this happen,I have purchased it only a couple of days ago,I have worked with it only for a few minutes!My final verdict would be, do not buy this laptop,from this seller even though he has 5 stars,I believe he is a scam and I suspect that all of his positive feedbacks are false and made up. I would hope that amazon would check its sellers more accuratelly than it is now.

ProductInfo.Features:
Intel Core i5-3210M 2.5GHz (3.1GHz with Turbo Boost, 3MB Cache)
8 GB DDR3 RAM
500 GB 7200 rpm Hard Drive
14.0-Inch Screen
Windows 8
ProductInfo.Name: Alienware M14x R2 AM14XR2-6111BK 14.0-Inch Laptop (Stealth Black with Soft Touch Finish)
